Stride Design Career Fair

January 14th, 2020 — UCSD PC East Ballroom

Register Your Company

What is Stride?

Stride connects top design students to career opportunities in the fields of human-centered design, human factors, user research, user experience, interaction design, UI design, visual design, content strategy, product management, product development, brand design, product design, UX engineering, web development and much more.

A Career Fair Catered to Designers

By catering an experience that fits the needs of design students and companies hiring designers, Stride isn’t your typical career fair. Stride helps students and companies build meaningful relationships, leading to stronger networks for students and successful, talented hires for companies.

An Environment That Promotes Conversations

At Stride, we find that the scale down setting allows for employers and students to engage in longer, more fruitful, conversations. Instead of just handing off a resume, it’s common, and highly encouraged, for 5-10 minute mini portfolio reviews to take place.

Access to Top Design Talent

UCSD boasts a strong design program pioneered by reputable academics such as Don Norman. The curriculum focuses on human computer interaction, design thinking, research, and product development. Many of our students graduate to pursue meaningful careers at top design-centric companies such as Google, Facebook, Salesforce, IBM, LinkedIn, Workday, Wish, Intuit, IDEO and more.

Interested in Connecting with UCSD Design Students?

If your company and/or your team in interested in Stride, please sign up! If you have questions or want to learn more about Stride, please contact our industry relations team at industryrelations@ucsddesign.co
